result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Darnell Bishop

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel contacted the Court and requested an adjournment to the hearing set for 10/21/2022 at 2:30PM due to medical reasons. Court does not object. Matter adjourned to a new date and time. All parties advised of the new date. Parties are also advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Anthony Darnell Bishop in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Anthony Darnell Bishop.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case called prior to the 10/14/2022 hearing on defense request.  Court lifted the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court.  Court granted defense request to adjourn the 10/14/2022 court date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Reserve Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Darnell Bishop not in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for pretrial conference.  No appearance by the defendant. Attorney Wales filed a notice of retainer and letter stating that he would be out of the office.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 13.
Calendar call scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089177,
Payable Number: 1033037,
Receipt Number: 22RP037556,
Amount: $20.00

No driving without a valid license. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Anthony Darnell Bishop in court. Attorney Madaline Witte appeared for the State of Wisconsin under the student practice rule. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 1p
